description: <p>Clinical Educator (Nurse)<br />£30,680 to £35,314 pro rata, per annum<br />30 hours per week, permanent<br /><br />We'd love you to join us at our Sue Ryder Duchess of Kent, CQC Outstanding Hospice.<br /><br />Do you love to teach? Do you enjoy helping others reach and exceed their development goals?<br /><br />A fantastic opportunity for a nurse with a keen interest in teaching and educating others to join our busy 15 bed hospice and extensive Community Palliative Care Teams.<br /><br />Sue Ryder is a national charity that supports people with life-limiting and neurological conditions and those who have been bereaved.<br /><br />In West Berkshire and South Oxfordshire, Sue Ryder provides multi professional palliative care in inpatient and community settings including Hospice at Home.<br /><br />About the Role:<br /><br />You will be part of a small team supporting the professional development of the clinical teams, including mandatory training, competency development and education in specialist palliative care.<br /><br />There are opportunities to maintain clinical practice within the service and to increase hours to full time by doing this regularly.<br /><br />You must hold a full UK Driving Licence with access to a car. The role is based Reading with travel between our four sites including Thatcham, Wokingham and Crowmarsh.<br /><br />You will be a registered clinical professional with the NMC or HCPC & educated to degree level (or working towards) with evidence of continuous professional development.<br /><br />For further information contact Laura Myers, Practice Educator on 07583 673552 or laura.myers@suerydercare.org<br /><br />About Us:<br /><br />Duchess of Kent is a Sue Ryder Hospice based in Reading. We provides expert palliative and end of life care, in a beautiful setting, for thousands of local people each year. We are part of a large charity but have a close relationship within the local community and offer a large range of specialist services to support patients, their families and friends.<br /><br />Competitive Benefits:<br />• £30,680 to £35,314 pro-rata, per annum (depending upon experience).<br />•Company pension scheme<br />•25 days holiday - rising to 30 with length of service plus bank holidays<br />•Enhanced maternity and paternity pay<br />•Enhanced sick pay<br />•Corporate discount with hundreds of retailers and services<br />•Staff discount of 15% on new goods online at shop.sueryder.org<br />•Season ticket loan<br />•Cash referral bonus scheme of up to £500<br />•Cycle to work scheme<br />• Free parking, tea and coffee and subsidised meals<br />• Wellbeing centre and free will writing service<br />• Development opportunities for all through our structured development framework<br /><br />Sue Ryder supports people through the most difficult times of their lives. Whether that’s a terminal illness, the loss of a loved one or a neurological condition – we’re there when it matters. Our doctors, nurses and carers give people the compassion and expert care they need to help them live the best life they possibly can.</p>
title: Clinical Educator
